task.title: Create a volume from a snapshot using euca2ools

taskbody.context: In this section of the lab you will create a new volume using the snapshot taken in the previous section of this lab. The new volume will include your partition information, file system, and the file that you wrote to the file system. You will also create a new instance and attach the new volume to the instance. Then you will view the data on the volume.

step.cmd: Create a new volume from the snapshot.

info.p: Note the volume ID as you will need it later.

step.cmd: Monitor the progress of volume creation until there is a status of available .

info.p: You should have two volumes. Make sure you understand which volume is the new volume. The new volume should have a snapshot ID associated with it.

step.cmd: From the front-end host, launch an instance. Wait for it to reach a running status.
Attach the new volume to the instance. It is the volume associated with the snapshot. Be sure to attach it to the device /dev/vdb.
View the state of the new volume and wait for it to be attached.
From the front-end host, use SSH to log in to the instance.
Create the /data directory to use as a mount point.
Mount the file system located on the volume to the /data directory.
Verify that the file system is available and that your customized file is present.
Exit the SSH session to the instance.
